programme.title: Missing In Minnesota
programme.desc: The clock is ticking as police in northern Minnesota rush to rescue a kidnapped college student. It takes NASA technology for law enforcement to uncover the identity of the abductor, who turns out to be a serial predator.

programme.title: A Killer Hand
programme.desc: The slaying of a casino worker in Las Vegas, Nevada sends panic through Sin City. When cops investigate beyond the bright lights of the strip, they uncover a murder conspiracy that is months in the making.

programme.title: The Craigslist Killer
programme.desc: When three different women who advertised in the Erotic Services section of Craigslist are assaulted, and one of them killed, Boston police match surveillance video and witness reports to a young man that no one would ever suspect to be a killer.

programme.title: Snipers In The Capital
programme.desc: When a deadly sniper terrorizes the DC area for weeks, frantic police put out an APB for a white van. But the FBI has a theory that there might be more than one sniper, and they're not driving a white van.

programme.title: Intern Gone Missing
programme.desc: When government intern Chandra Levy goes missing just hours after she decides to move to a new city, detectives discover she may have been having an affair with a senator – the only suspect with a possible motive. A man already in jail claims to know more, but can he be trusted?

programme.title: An Ex Attacks
programme.desc: When a young man is brutally murdered in his home, the only suspect with a motive is his ex-girlfriend, who claims she hasn't seen the victim for months. But detectives uncover a digital camera in the victim's washing machine, DNA evidence, and phone messages that tell a different story.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Continuing their adventure in Alaska‚Äôs interior, Steve, Doug, and Mark push deeper into the caribou migration. With Doug still hoping to take his first bull, the team sets up on a high ridge, watching caribou stream across the landscape. They face grizzly bears, dense fog, and the ever-changing weather of the Alaskan wilderness. As the days pass, they work together to intercept a herd of caribou, knowing their window could close.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode, Steven Rinella steps out of the field and into the kitchen to showcase some of his favorite wild game recipes. From wild turkey sausage and smoked trout to venison ribs and duck breast, he shares simple yet sophisticated ways to prepare these dishes. This cooking masterclass is a celebration of wild game, offering both seasoned hunters and novice cooks new ways to enjoy the fruits of their hunts.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve heads to the panhandle of Idaho to join wildlife biologist and dedicated houndsman Bart George for a mountain lion hunt. Bruce Dunkin, Bart‚Äôs mentor and hunting buddy, joins the crew as they attempt to cut a cat‚Äôs track and let the dogs loose for a hunt in the deep timber of the Idaho mountains.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and Evan Hafer head into Southeast Alaska's coastal rainforest to hunt Sitka black-tailed deer. Using deer calls and antler rattling to mimic buck fights, they navigate through thick muskegs and challenging terrain. Despite tough weather conditions and elusive game, the two friends adapt to the conditions and stick it out, making the most of their hunt.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella and Clay Newcomb head to Nebraska's Sandhills for a whitetail deer hunt, guided by Jordan Budd, an outfitter with a deep knowledge of the local terrain. As they navigate the wide-open spaces and cornfields, Jordan uses her expertise to narrow down the movement patters of the cagey bucks. The thick corn fields provide cover and food for the deer, making a tough hunt for the team.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella joins Jean-Paul Bourgeois and Ronnie Collins in Louisiana‚ Mississippi Delta for a duck hunt. Surrounded by the unique landscape of the Delta, they target multiple duck species. After a successful hunt, the team returns to camp, where Jean-Paul prepares a traditional Cajun meal featuring the day‚ catch. Experience the cultural tradition of turning fresh game into flavorful, local dishes like duck gumbo and crawfish boil.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to New Mexico‚Äôs Gila Wilderness with his friend Carl Malcolm to hunt Merriam‚Äôs turkeys. Set against a backdrop of stunning landscapes and rich history, they explore the first federally protected wilderness in the world. Although few and far between, the duo find gobbling birds through hard scouting and perseverence.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella heads to the Gulf of Mexico for a spearfishing adventure beneath the oil rigs that serve as artificial reefs. Joined by his spearfishing mentor Greg Fonts and Brandon Hendrickson, they target a variety of prized fish, including Cobia and red snapper. The episode captures the thrill of diving in murky waters filled with sharks and navigating the massive structures. Along the way, they showcase the rich marine life of the Gulf and the skills needed to harvest fresh seafood.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella, Ryan Callahan, and Danny Bolton travel to Hawaii's Big Island for a unique hunt. They stalk feral sheep in the lush mountainsides and target wild hogs on a coffee plantation, using the animals' movements through macadamia groves to their advantage. The episode highlights Hawaii's blend of hunting and conservation, ending with a Hawaiian-style feast featuring the fresh game they harvested.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella teams up with spearfishing champions Danny Bolton and Kimi Werner off Hawaii‚ coast for a thrilling underwater adventure. Targeting pelagic species like Mahi Mahi and yellowfin tuna, the crew navigates the deep blue waters, dodging sharks and learning to use fish aggregating devices (FADs) to attract game fish. After they spear a variety of species, including a massive Ono, the team ends with a fresh, ocean-to-table feast, celebrating the rich marine life of Hawaii.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode of MeatEater, Steven Rinella and Clay Newcomb head into Alaska's remote interior for a challenging moose hunt. Over a 10-day season, they navigate the rugged wilderness, using patient calling to attract moose. Finding a legal bull and navigating through thick vegetation are just two of the challenges faced on this trip. The hunt captures the essence of moose hunting: patience, adaptation, and persistence in one of the world‚Äôs wildest places.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve introduces Randall Williams and Clay Newcomb to his fish shack in Prince of Wales, Alaska where they fish for cod, set shrimp pots and hunt for black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. Steve jets off to his home state of Michigan to hunt for small game with friends Guy Zuck and Kevin Murphy.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this trip, Steve and Jason Phelps hunt for big mule deer in one of Idaho's most prized units, giving Steve an opportunity at his dream muley.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Hunter, author, cook and conservationist Steven Rinella treks into the world's most remote and beautiful regions, bringing game meat from field to table. On this hunt, Steve and Janis Putelis are in Florida with local, Richard Martinez, in search for the illusive Osceola Turkey.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: Nadia travels to the region of Lazio, home to the iconic city of Rome and birthplace of the Pasta Queen herself. Nadia shares three classic dishes she calls the Holy Trinity of Pasta: Cacio E Pepe, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, and Bucatini all’Amatriciana. All three dishes use Lazio’s legendary cheese -- Pecorino Romano, so Nadia takes a deep dive into this key ingredient.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: While exploring Lazio, Nadia shares a Roman summer classic, Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms, in preparation for a summer dinner party. For the main course, Nadia concocts one of her specialties, Lemon Peel Ricotta Pesto. And what party would be complete without a refreshing cocktail? Make no mistake, this Negroni Sbagliato is simply stunning!

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: The region of Emilia-Romagna is home to the most well-known ingredients in Italian cuisine. Nadia travels into the heart of Bologna to learn how to make Tortellini and then to Modena to learn the process of making Balsamic Vinegar with Michelin Star Chef Massimo Bottura. Using a few potatoes and some modified poultry, Nadia highlights how this region is the capital of food and a force of nature!

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: Nadia travels to the region of Lazio, home to the iconic city of Rome and birthplace of the Pasta Queen herself. Nadia shares three classic dishes she calls the Holy Trinity of Pasta: Cacio E Pepe, Spaghetti alla Carbonara, and Bucatini all’Amatriciana. All three dishes use Lazio’s legendary cheese -- Pecorino Romano, so Nadia takes a deep dive into this key ingredient.

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: While exploring Lazio, Nadia shares a Roman summer classic, Stuffed Zucchini Blossoms, in preparation for a summer dinner party. For the main course, Nadia concocts one of her specialties, Lemon Peel Ricotta Pesto. And what party would be complete without a refreshing cocktail? Make no mistake, this Negroni Sbagliato is simply stunning!

programme.title: The Pasta Queen
programme.desc: The region of Emilia-Romagna is home to the most well-known ingredients in Italian cuisine. Nadia travels into the heart of Bologna to learn how to make Tortellini and then to Modena to learn the process of making Balsamic Vinegar with Michelin Star Chef Massimo Bottura. Using a few potatoes and some modified poultry, Nadia highlights how this region is the capital of food and a force of nature!
